SENTENCE.STRING: Mount Maunganui is a suburb of the city of Tauranga, Bay of Plenty, New Zealand, located on a peninsula to the north of the city, and north west of fellow suburb Papamoa.
It is also the name of

ORIGINAL-REFEX.REFEX: the extinct volcanic cone which rises above the town

SENTENCE.STRING: is colloquially known in New Zealand simply as The Mount.
The town itself is located on top of a sand bar that connects
to the mainland, a geographical formation known as a tombolo.
Because of this formation, the residents of Mount Maunganui are lucky enough to have both a harbour beach (Pilot Bay) and an ocean beach to take advantage of, within a short distance (At the base of
, the distance between the harbour and ocean side is a couple of blocks).
